hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Suppression Breakout Following Dovish Catalyst
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL/BULL regimes with suppressed volatility (BTC 20-day realized vol < 40%), the arrival of a clear positive macro catalyst (e.g., dovish Fed comments, soft inflation data) will trigger a volatility expansion breakout. A long entry on a break above the overnight range high will capture amplified momentum as systematic and options-related flows compound the move.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low volatility environments act as coiled springs. A clear catalyst provides the energy for a directional move. The breakout is amplified by vol-targeting funds increasing exposure, short gamma dealers hedging, and momentum algorithms piling in.
entry_conditions: Clear positive macro catalyst occurs during trading hours
BTC price trades above the high of the prior day's (UTC) range
Entry on break above day's high + 0.1% buffer

exit_conditions.take_profit: Target based on 1x the average true range (ATR) of the prior 5 days, added to entry
exit_conditions.time_exit: Close of the daily candle after entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakouts following such catalysts in low vol regimes fail (hit stop before target) >60% of the time, or average win is less than average loss.
